column4: My son just bought a laptop (MSI CR620) and we're trying to put ubuntu on it, but the USB stick installer and the CD install (11.04 desktop amd64) both just get stuck on the "ubuntu ..." screen - any ideas how to troubleshoot?
try booting the alternate installer, see if you can get to a command line
how do you make it boot that? is there a key to press during boot?
wols: I found the alternate text based installer on the ubuntu site - I'll try that.
download and burn the alternate iso
have you tried booting with your wireless device disabled? My laptops can toggle it off, and theres probably a way to disable it in the bios too
that's not what your lookingfor

You can blacklist a module using the following syntax: module_name.blacklist=yes. This will cause the module to be blacklisted in /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.local both during the installation and for the installed system.
is that in the grub boot commands?
yes, youll have to determine the actual module nome from someone else or google, I have no idea what to actually put there, but it can be done
ok trying it now :) what's the correct way to see the boot log during boot instead of the graphical progress thingy?
remove "quiet splash" from the boot options
are we talking about in grub here? I don't see anything to do with quiet splash
press "E" to edit the boot command
my bad - found it
should the module.blacklist=yes be an option to the 'linux' command or before it on a separate line?
to the linux command
ok retrying :D I'm new to editing the grub commands - it's fun
you are a superstar!!!
the blacklist thing works great - now I think I will be able to get the fixed module and make it all work (or at least get it to boot to try!)
you shoul;d propose a workaround on that bug report
ok, will do :)
